title: Who is Naim Qassem? Hezbollah leader who allegedly fled to Tehran amid fear of assassination
content: Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary-General, Naim Qassem, has taken refuge in Tehran after fleeing Lebanon due to fears of assassination by Israel. Qassem departed Beirut on October 5 on an Iranian aircraft. Following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death, Qassem has delivered speeches from both Beirut and Tehran. Israel continues to target Hezbollah leaders.
summary: Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary-General, Naim Qassem, has taken refuge in Tehran after fleeing Lebanon due to fears of assassination by Israel. Qassem departed Beirut on October 5 on an Iranian aircraft. Following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death, Qassem has delivered speeches from both Beirut and Tehran. Israel continues to target Hezbollah leaders.

title: 'Lights so bright, can only see black ones': Harris' campaign shares clip of Trump's controversial speech
content: Kamala Harris' campaign reposted a clip of Donald Trump's February 24 speech in Columbia, South Carolina, which drew criticism for its perceived racial insensitivity. Trump remarked he could only see Black people in the audience. Social media exploded with backlash, though some defended Trump, arguing the comment was humorous. Trump's history of controversial statements on race adds context.
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign reposted a clip of Donald Trump's February 24 speech in Columbia, South Carolina, which drew criticism for its perceived racial insensitivity. Trump remarked he could only see Black people in the audience. Social media exploded with backlash, though some defended Trump, arguing the comment was humorous. Trump's history of controversial statements on race adds context.

title: 'If baby can survive outside womb then ...': Elon Musk shares his stance on abortion ban
content: Elon Musk, while supporting Donald Trump, states that abortion is murder if a baby can survive outside the womb, highlighting the complexity of the issue. He criticizes education for instilling fear in young girls about motherhood, emphasizing that having children can bring unparalleled joy.
summary: Elon Musk, while supporting Donald Trump, states that abortion is murder if a baby can survive outside the womb, highlighting the complexity of the issue. He criticizes education for instilling fear in young girls about motherhood, emphasizing that having children can bring unparalleled joy.

title: 'Don't respect them as soldiers': Trump responds to being called 'most dangerous person ever'
content: Former US President Trump responds to criticism from retired General Jim Mattis and General Mark Milley, who describe him as a threat to the nation. Trump dismisses them as 'woke' and 'not great generals,' criticizing Milley's advice on Afghanistan and questioning their leadership abilities.
summary: Former US President Trump responds to criticism from retired General Jim Mattis and General Mark Milley, who describe him as a threat to the nation. Trump dismisses them as 'woke' and 'not great generals,' criticizing Milley's advice on Afghanistan and questioning their leadership abilities.

title: Watch: Trump puts on Apron, works at McDonald's drive-through in latest viral video
content: Donald Trump ran a fry station at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, challenging Kamala Harris's college job claims. Wearing an apron, he prepared fries while jabbing at Harris's story. He held an impromptu press conference from the drive-thru, making headlines as Election Day approaches. Trump praised the workers but skirted questions on minimum wage policies.
summary: Donald Trump ran a fry station at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, challenging Kamala Harris's college job claims. Wearing an apron, he prepared fries while jabbing at Harris's story. He held an impromptu press conference from the drive-thru, making headlines as Election Day approaches. Trump praised the workers but skirted questions on minimum wage policies.

title: Panda rentals come with strings attached: 5 things China expects
content: Panda agreements between American zoos and the China Wildlife Conservation Association are tightly controlled, with zoos agreeing to limit communication about panda health and finances, pay for Chinese experts' trips, restrict live feeds, and face potential contract termination for unauthorized disclosures.
summary: Panda agreements between American zoos and the China Wildlife Conservation Association are tightly controlled, with zoos agreeing to limit communication about panda health and finances, pay for Chinese experts' trips, restrict live feeds, and face potential contract termination for unauthorized disclosures.

title: Dollar-starved Maldives notifies new foreign currency rules
Brazil's President Lula cancels Russia trip for Brics summit following head injury
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva canceled his trip to the Brics summit due to a head injury sustained from a fall. Advised against long flights, he will participate via videoconference. Foreign Minister Mauro Vieira will lead Brazil's delegation in his place.
summary: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva canceled his trip to the Brics summit due to a head injury sustained from a fall. Advised against long flights, he will participate via videoconference. Foreign Minister Mauro Vieira will lead Brazil's delegation in his place.

title: 'Poor choice of approaches ... ': Arnold Palmer's daughter reacts to Trump's unexpected tribute to golf legend
content: Arnold Palmer's daughter found Donald Trump's tribute to her father inappropriate but wasn't upset. She mentioned her father's affinity for golf and belief in the Republican Party. Trump's tribute at a Latrobe rally included a controversial anecdote. Patrick Wears will vote in the upcoming election as an unaffiliated voter.
summary: Arnold Palmer's daughter found Donald Trump's tribute to her father inappropriate but wasn't upset. She mentioned her father's affinity for golf and belief in the Republican Party. Trump's tribute at a Latrobe rally included a controversial anecdote. Patrick Wears will vote in the upcoming election as an unaffiliated voter.

title: Missing crew members found dead after fighter jet crash in Washington state
content: Two US Navy aviators were found dead after their EA-18G Growler jet crashed near Mount Rainier during a training flight. Search teams, including a Navy helicopter and Army Special Forces, located the wreckage in a remote, densely wooded area. The Navy has transitioned to a salvage operation and is investigating the cause of the crash.
summary: Two US Navy aviators were found dead after their EA-18G Growler jet crashed near Mount Rainier during a training flight. Search teams, including a Navy helicopter and Army Special Forces, located the wreckage in a remote, densely wooded area. The Navy has transitioned to a salvage operation and is investigating the cause of the crash.

title: 'Worked 15 minutes more than Kamala ... ' Trump visits McDonald's in Philadelphia; works the frier
content: Former President Donald Trump visited a McDonald's in Philadelphia, where he mocked Vice President Kamala Harris's claim of working at the chain during college. Trump aimed to connect with blue-collar voters, drawing support outside while Democrats protested across the street.
summary: Former President Donald Trump visited a McDonald's in Philadelphia, where he mocked Vice President Kamala Harris's claim of working at the chain during college. Trump aimed to connect with blue-collar voters, drawing support outside while Democrats protested across the street.

title: Georgia shooting: One killed, multiple injured in Albany State University
content: A shooting at Albany State University in Georgia during a homecoming week concert left one person dead and six injured. The incident occurred around 8:50 pm on East campus. The Georgia Bureau of Investigation is leading the probe. The identities of the victims remain undisclosed, but a 19-year-old from Atlanta has died.
summary: A shooting at Albany State University in Georgia during a homecoming week concert left one person dead and six injured. The incident occurred around 8:50 pm on East campus. The Georgia Bureau of Investigation is leading the probe. The identities of the victims remain undisclosed, but a 19-year-old from Atlanta has died.

title: 'Running on vibes': Pollster Nate Silver gives 24 reasons why Trump could win
content: Nate Silver outlines 24 reasons why Donald Trump could win the US presidential election, highlighting factors like electoral college bias, inflation, voter perceptions, and populism, along with Harris's far-left stance, media skepticism, and third-party candidates. Close poll margins emphasize the election's competitive nature.
summary: Nate Silver outlines 24 reasons why Donald Trump could win the US presidential election, highlighting factors like electoral college bias, inflation, voter perceptions, and populism, along with Harris's far-left stance, media skepticism, and third-party candidates. Close poll margins emphasize the election's competitive nature.

title: Harris turns 60, but prefers to talk about Trump's age
content: Kamala Harris is celebrating her 60th birthday amid a tight election contest with Donald Trump. Both candidates, along with their high-profile surrogates, are campaigning in key battleground states like Pennsylvania. Harris takes aim at Trump's mental fitness and hosts rallies with celebrities Lizzo and Usher, while Trump campaigns vigorously despite age concerns.
summary: Kamala Harris is celebrating her 60th birthday amid a tight election contest with Donald Trump. Both candidates, along with their high-profile surrogates, are campaigning in key battleground states like Pennsylvania. Harris takes aim at Trump's mental fitness and hosts rallies with celebrities Lizzo and Usher, while Trump campaigns vigorously despite age concerns.

title: Fries with that?: Trump to work french fry cooker at McDonald’s
'Don't get popped': Kamala under fire over campaign ad targeting black men's love life
content: Kamala Harris faces criticism over a new campaign ad targeting black men's voting behavior via Instagram and Snapchat. The ad, aimed largely at women, has sparked backlash for being seen as patronizing. As the election nears, both Harris and Trump intensify their campaigns, urging early voting with celebrity endorsements.
summary: Kamala Harris faces criticism over a new campaign ad targeting black men's voting behavior via Instagram and Snapchat. The ad, aimed largely at women, has sparked backlash for being seen as patronizing. As the election nears, both Harris and Trump intensify their campaigns, urging early voting with celebrity endorsements.

title: Israeli strikes in northern Gaza leave 87 dead or missing: Gaza health ministry
content: Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza resulted in at least 87 casualties, with additional injuries in Beit Lahiya. Israel's military continues operations targeting Hamas militants. The conflict has severely impacted Gaza's northern region, displacing many residents. Concurrently, the US is probing leaked documents on Israel's potential response plans to Iran's missile attack.
summary: Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza resulted in at least 87 casualties, with additional injuries in Beit Lahiya. Israel's military continues operations targeting Hamas militants. The conflict has severely impacted Gaza's northern region, displacing many residents. Concurrently, the US is probing leaked documents on Israel's potential response plans to Iran's missile attack.

title: Yahya Sinwar's wife seen carrying $32,000 handbag in tunnel escape footage: IDF
content: IDF claims that former Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's wife, Samar Muhammad Abu Zamar, was seen with a $32,000 Hermès Birkin handbag as they fled into a tunnel before the October 7 attack on Israel. Lieutenant Colonel Avichay Adraee highlighted the wealth disparity between Sinwar's family and ordinary Gazan citizens. Sinwar was killed by Israeli forces in Gaza on Wednesday.
summary: IDF claims that former Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's wife, Samar Muhammad Abu Zamar, was seen with a $32,000 Hermès Birkin handbag as they fled into a tunnel before the October 7 attack on Israel. Lieutenant Colonel Avichay Adraee highlighted the wealth disparity between Sinwar's family and ordinary Gazan citizens. Sinwar was killed by Israeli forces in Gaza on Wednesday.

title: Israel escalates Beirut bombing, kill 73 in Gaza strike, 70 projectiles cross from Lebanon within minutes: Top developments
content: Israeli military strikes targeted Hezbollah centers in Beirut amid escalating tensions. The attack hit intelligence headquarters and weapons facilities, with additional clashes reported in southern Lebanon. Simultaneously, the Gaza offensive resulted in significant casualties. Prime Minister Netanyahu accused Hezbollah of an assassination attempt, intensifying the conflict. Classified US documents revealing Israel’s military strategies were also leaked.
summary: Israeli military strikes targeted Hezbollah centers in Beirut amid escalating tensions. The attack hit intelligence headquarters and weapons facilities, with additional clashes reported in southern Lebanon. Simultaneously, the Gaza offensive resulted in significant casualties. Prime Minister Netanyahu accused Hezbollah of an assassination attempt, intensifying the conflict. Classified US documents revealing Israel’s military strategies were also leaked.

title: Chinese food delivery industry faces downturn, workers' earnings drop by 1,000 yuan
content: China's USD 200 billion food delivery industry, which thrived during the pandemic, faces a downturn due to economic challenges. Delivery workers are seeing reduced incomes and job stability as consumer spending weakens. Workers now earn less despite longer hours and face increased risks from tight delivery deadlines, making it difficult to sustain livelihoods.
summary: China's USD 200 billion food delivery industry, which thrived during the pandemic, faces a downturn due to economic challenges. Delivery workers are seeing reduced incomes and job stability as consumer spending weakens. Workers now earn less despite longer hours and face increased risks from tight delivery deadlines, making it difficult to sustain livelihoods.
